answers.answer: Hi,Are the shoes that you using currently comfortable? Have you changed your shoes in the last 6 months? Do you have a standing job? Well it is difficult to comment on the lesions without having a look at them. Consult your physician and get a clinical examination done.

Maybe i have the same thing! 3 red bumps on my sole, one of them is bigger (3-4mm diameter) don't feel any pain, itching or anything.I have 3 shoes wearing a different shoe each day, I don't stand too much.

Neuropathy. people that do not have Diabetes gets this as well.as people that do. If any person gets small round bumps.sometimes they may burn or tingle or not. and some get them on palms of hands and bottom of feet. its called Neuropathy. If you have these please show your dr.as time goes on they may get worse.

question: I have had red bumps on the soles of my feet for about 6 months.  They don't seem to be getting any better or worse.  I wanted to know if there was anything I could do over the counter for them.  There is no itching, swelling or pain associated with them.  Thanks
title: Red Bumps on soles of feet
